alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 4:13AM EST until January 11 at 6:24AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Raritan River At Manville affecting Somerset and Middlesex Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Raritan River at Manville. * WHEN...Until this morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, At this level, inundation begins in Dukes Park in Manville. At 12.0 feet, Cautionary/Action stage is reached. Roads and trails flood within Dukes Park. At 13.0 feet, Southside Avenue in Somerville floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EST Thursday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 AM EST Thursday was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise below flood stage early this morning and then rise to a crest of 12.9 feet early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.3 feet on 01/28/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Raritan River Manville 14.0 14.4 Thu 3 am 8.8 10.2 Crested &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this morning at 630 AM EST.
